meanings.definition: A microform containing microimages of documents.
meanings.sent1: The library had an ultrafiche with tiny pictures of old letters.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use ultrafiche to access historical documents in a compact format.
meanings.sent3: I tried to read the ultrafiche upside down and ended up seeing miniature upside-down letters!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an ultrafiche, storing memories in tiny, organized images.
meanings.sent5: The ultrafiche revealed a world of information in its small microimages.

meanings.definition: To store documents in microform on ultrafiche.
meanings.sent1: They decided to ultrafiche the important papers for safekeeping.
meanings.sent2: The office uses a special machine to ultrafiche and store sensitive documents.
meanings.sent3: I ultrafiche my notes so I can carry them all in my pocket!
meanings.sent4: Her mind seemed to ultrafiche the details of the meeting for easy recall.
meanings.sent5: The company chose to ultrafiche their records to save space and preserve them.

meanings.definition: The act of viewing documents on ultrafiche.
meanings.sent1: The ultrafiche viewing room was quiet as people examined the microimages.
meanings.sent2: Students learned about history through the ultrafiche viewing sessions.
meanings.sent3: He found it amusing to pretend the ultrafiche was a tiny movie screen.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes scanned the ultrafiche like a detective searching for clues.
meanings.sent5: The ultrafiche viewing experience made the documents come alive in miniature form.
